website_summaries.verdict: This knife is costly, but it's worth the investment if you're looking for a quality blade that will hold its edge for years.
pros: Stainless steel blade that is almost 5 inches long
Soft grip handle that comes in 3 colors
Holds a sharp edge for a long time
Durable knife that lasts for years
cons: This knife may be too expensive for those that are on a budget

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Outdoor Knife
customer_reviews.text: Gerber makes excellent knives, and this is no exception. Great utility knife to take on camping hiking, or otherwise any outdoor adventure you may have. I love that the sheath comes with a built in sharpener, and the knife handle is very beefy and ergonomic. Knife blade as with most Gerber knives is sharp as always and retains an edge well. And you can turn this into a spear if a survival need for that ever arose. Super useful outdoor knife, and probably one of the best.
customer_reviews.author: Allan S.

customer_reviews.title: Very good knife
customer_reviews.text: Paint started chipping off both sides soon after I started using the knife. I don't care, because the functionality isn't harmed, I still love it. Nothing else it wrong with it, perfect knife. Update: Basically all the paint came off, so I scraped the rest off. The little plastic supports at the base of the blade broke, but I don't blame them since I was using the knife as a hatchet. I should've just used an ax, but I was too lazy to grab one. The blade wiggles around just a little, but it is my own doing so the knife rates 10 stars. I would definitely recommend this knife to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: Little Red Hen

customer_reviews.title: A solid value, and awesome knife
customer_reviews.text: This knife speaks for itself, and many other reviewers have given it the high praise it deserves. I've taken mine camping with much luck, etc. It's an honest tool. The point I want to make is about the totally reasonable price. I just bought my second, to replace my misplaced first bought (that's a mouthful) and I think the price has gone down!! When does that ever happen? Thank you Gerber!! For the same price as a take-out dinner or couple of pizzas you can own a legacy, made in USA, premium knife. I say tack $25 onto the price and contribute the proceeds to a suitable Veterans charity. I'd be more than happy to.
customer_reviews.author: G-money

customer_reviews.title: Gerber LMF II Survival Knife, Black - Yikes!!!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty serious blade, unless your using this 24/7 this thing will hold up more than fine, and is overkill for your average person. I hike only a few times a year and this is more than I would need, haven't camped in years but this Gerber has you covered, you will not be disappointed, great quality. If its good enough for the military its more than fine for me, and for about $60.00-$65.00 what I paid, you can always get a new one if you have issues.
customer_reviews.author: Nat 2

customer_reviews.title: Really handy
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this knife, I bring it anywhere I go hiking. It's really durable and I've used it for cutting down branches and twigs for fire. As well as cutting lines.I keep it on my right thigh at all times. Just make sure you oil it down from time to time to keep it from rusting. the black coating wears out eventually from getting scratched and exposes the metal.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew L

customer_reviews.title: Nice knife
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted it to collect it. Impressive tool. I have another smaller knife with a clip on sheath. I clip it onto the MOLLE velcro at the lower end of the sheath so I can carry two knives in one place. Comes with a sharpener built into the sheath, but I recommend buying a Smith's as well for the serrated parts. Also it's kind of a drag to fit the knife through the small sharpening slot in the sheath with each draw, and hard to match the curve of the blade at the end with this method. Don't get me wrong... I like the feature, and I can see it would be good to have in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great killing knife
customer_reviews.text: I use this knife for gator hunting. I love this knife. Its extremely sharp and great in the hands. When things get messy and slippery I feel like I can securely hold on to this knife. It looks great on the thigh and its low enough not to be in the way when sitting down and high enough to not be in way of any walking movement. It looks so great, my brother asked to get him one as well.
customer_reviews.author: M. Coletti

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Having a small build, I was worried that some of the reviews said how great the knife fitted in their hands. Even with my small hands, it feels great. Love that it is made in the U S of A. The sheath seems well made. Love how there are multiple ways to wear it, since once again with the small body, the calf position would be a thigh position.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri M

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Sharp, Strong. I purchased this as a backpacking tool, for both safety and camping needs. It comes with leg straps and sheath. I've never used the leg straps... they felt uncomfortably to me. But, others my like that feature. I strap the knife to my belt, and it works well. Great Balance, and comfortable to grip. Note: This is a heavy knife for backpacking. The strength, and durability make up for the weight... But you need to be aware, this product is heavy and bulky in terms of backpacking. I love the spear feature, and the sharpener. I'll always bring this with when I backpack. This is a must have in a Survival Situation.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Buy this knife!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best knives for the money. This thing is durable and will last a lifetime. It is a great survival knife and one of my first picks if I were in a survival situation. It is well balanced and had a durable feel to it. It is not excessively heavy. It also has holes where the knife meets the handle to attach it to a stick to use as a spear. Buy this knife!
customer_reviews.author: Cameron King

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: I got this much cheaper online than in the box stores (BassPro). It's the real deal, such a solid knife. Love the sheath etc. I can't speak to quality long term etc. since I just got it and really don't intend to use it, lol. Part of my tactical gear/bug out gear.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Worthy of Gerber's OLDER name/reputation
customer_reviews.text: As a knife-afi (knife aficionado-it's a Spyderco thang!) I am used to the term "Gerber" being a joke sometimes (based on their $19.99 Wal-Mart stuff) but let me assure you this PORTLAND USA MADE LMFII is a piece of work! I carry a Daniel Winkler Operator on me almost everyday (along with at least 2 Spydercos) but THIS is the knife in my "Rapid Deployment" bag when I work (I'm a patrol lieutenant with a mid-sized agency and teach firearms, TASER, and Rapid Deployment/Active Shooter).
customer_reviews.author: David from NC

customer_reviews.title: Can't get it sharp enough for my standards.
customer_reviews.text: I just can't get it sharp. I have a wicked edge system that gets all my other knifes hair popping sharp this one tears paper. I guess i'm not happy with 420hc. I sharpened to 9 micron @46 degree total, really no excuse not to be able to slice paper well. Not enough flat blade on it either it turns to serrated way too quick. I love how the handle feels and you could use this knife for weight lifting.
customer_reviews.author: David Sanders

customer_reviews.title: LMFII Highly Recommended . Made to last !
customer_reviews.text: Got this knife for post i work at . Arrived in hard plastic packaging came with everything . Strong molle setup for attaching various ways . Knife is thick and comes sharp . If you want a drop leg setup you need a Molle Leg Extender piece. Knife fits in Kydex holster securely . LMFII dwarfs other knives letting you know its intended for combat and survival use . I recommend this knife !
customer_reviews.author: lilcuppycakez

customer_reviews.title: Defect product: crooked serrations
customer_reviews.text: The serration section of the knife was cut out crooked. This made it very very prone to snagging as things cut would get stuck between the serrated section and the smooth blade section. I believe that it is a detect but such an obvious defect should not have been overlooked by anyone inspecting this black. It was the first thing I noticed. So obvious. Other than that it is a very confortable knofe to hold and has a nice holster. I returned the product and never got a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Nikandros

customer_reviews.title: good but limited use.
customer_reviews.text: If the world had gone to hell this might be the knife I'd want. It has a nice heft and sense of durability. The spine is cut at a nice angle that makes striking magnesium fire starters a breeze and the sheath has a built in sharpener that will keep the blade going for who knows how long. That being said its a bit large and heavy and probably overkill for most people. You do not want to bring this type of knife backpacking with you unless you're trying to lose some weight.
customer_reviews.author: Drew D

customer_reviews.title: Lifetime knife
customer_reviews.text: Serious cutting power, excellent grade material, well designed for adventure camping, fishing, hunting, survival training or just survival. Leg strap doesn't feel right to me; slips down or too tight. Belt strap is best for easy access. Sharpening sheath works well and the knife snaps in very firmly. This is also a serious weapon with leads for lashing to a pole.
customer_reviews.author: Woof

customer_reviews.title: Versatile knife
customer_reviews.text: It's a very versatile knife. Very sharp and has a cutting feature on the back part of the lower blade. I also like the many positions you can mount the sheath. It also come with a knife sharpener.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene T Miller

customer_reviews.title: A well made tactical and survival knife
customer_reviews.text: This is what it says it is. A well made tactical and survival knife. It beats what I had years ago in the military. Sharp, strong balanced well with multi uses. I love knives and am totally pleased with this. It is not the size of a Kabar but then it was not designed that way.
customer_reviews.author: Veritas

customer_reviews.title: If you Care for yours it will care for you.
customer_reviews.text: You shouldn't have to use the butt of your knife for any reason, unless you absolutely run out of options. the handle seems to be holding up well and hasn't weakened on me yet.This is a very sturdy tool. I've beaten this thing up using "the blade" like an axe and pry bar. It still keeps a sharp enough edge to carry out the day. It's a well made knife to have with you wherever, whatever and/or whenever.
customer_reviews.author: Vlad

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic knife is a great all-around performer
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic knife is a great all-around performer. It is a solid / quality survival knife. Possibly the best feeling knife in the hand I've ever held. Really absorbs shock, perfect grippy-ness. It's not the best survival blade,fighting blade, tactical blade individually... it's the best all-around. For someone wanting the best 1-shot go-to, you can't go wrong with this blade. The only negative is that some people have broken the hand-guard portion while batoning (splitting wood). If you are careful not to hit the finger-guard you will not have any problems and it will split wood like a beast.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Nice knife fast shipping but...
customer_reviews.text: Razor sharp out the package. Knife feels heavy and sturdy. Sheath is well designed and well made. The package I received also included a belt cutting knife with sheath (not shown in the pictures, kinda surprise)-- nice to keep in the car. Have to remove one star--the knife sharpener -should be on the sheath--was not installed! It's missing! I already opened the clam shell package and guess it's hard to return
customer_reviews.author: ZL

customer_reviews.title: I bought 2
customer_reviews.text: Blade is ALMOST full tang and that is GOOD. It stops at the base of your palm. Why? The base spike (more or less) is meant to break brick and other hard services. If the base metal cracks due to impacts, the blade is still good. Blade itself is thick enough to a baton, but keep in mind it is a short blade as it is a knife. Sharpener, well it's better than nothing or trying to find a decent stone. Best bang for the buck IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Mister E.

customer_reviews.title: More Versatile than a Puma White Hunter
customer_reviews.text: After 35 years of ownership I lost my Puma Whit Hunter when our camp was burglarized. I needed a replacement but the $400.00 +/- price of a new one was too steep. Upon significant shopping and review of currently available survival knives it became apparent that the commercial supply has grown over the years. The Gerber is a very good piece. It quickly sharpened to "shave hair" edge and handles well. The scabbard and accessories provided give many cary options. I still prefer the White hunter, probably for nostalgic reasons, but I saved $300.00. I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: J. Finnegan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Knife
customer_reviews.text: Real Strong Survival Knife that can hand any ask. I bought it for my EDC Bag/Get Home Bag. Since I'm in an Urban setting and might have to cut through walls during one of our West Coast earth quakes. This knife is designed to cut through wiring without getting zapped. Works equally as well for Bush Craft chores/living.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Gerber - Quality Control SUCKS
customer_reviews.text: This is the third for three orders that had either scratches, gouges or mis-aligned functionality. How did ANY of these 3 for 3 make it to the public as a retail item and not B-Stock?
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Gerber LFM II Black Infantry Knife
customer_reviews.text: While I own many knives, Gerber is climbing the list very rapidly. The quality of the materials used keeps pace with the advances in technology, from metals to plastics. The weight and balance of the knife is great and the feel is awesome. My EDC is Microtec (various models) so understandably this knife has to be great. Well it is, the sheath is very secure and the handle is just right. If it were concealable, I might even consider it for my EDC. I also have Gerber multitools which are well designed and easy to operate.
customer_reviews.author: gabriel murphy

customer_reviews.title: Fits the specs
customer_reviews.text: This knife is a special purpose tool, and as far as I can tell, it fits the required specs for being able to carve and smash your way out of a downed aircraft without electrocuting yourself pretty well. Great sheath with three retention points and integral sharpener. Also comes with elasticized, adjustable leg and ankle straps that I'll probably never use. Wouldn't be the one I'd take to the woods for a month, but I was flying behind enemy lines, this would be the one. Four out of five stars for too many parts, which equals too many failure points.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great USA made knife.
customer_reviews.text: Great knife! As stated I got the sheath and nylon "frame" and 2 leg straps as stated in the description. Very adaptable sheath system. Very thick blade and heavy oxide coating and got sharp enough to shave off arm hairs after a quick sharpening with the supplied sharpener. Has a nice weight to it and the grip feels GREAT in hand with very grippy texture. Yes, it does not have a full metal tang but a 3/4s tang and still immensely strong. It doesn't have a full tang for 3 good reasons. 1st is for electrical insulation 2nd is to provide a shock absorber for the hammer end and 3rd, to keep the weight down.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Need better sheath
customer_reviews.text: Nice knife but for the price I expected a better sheath. It’s a complicated multi-piece affair that relies on velcro ( yes, velcro) to hold the 2 main pieces together.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Gratsinger

customer_reviews.title: Great, relatively small camping knife. Contains most of the tools you'll need in one
customer_reviews.text: It has most of the tools you'll need in the field, and can stand up to it with ease. Only problem is that the blade is short enough they probably should have made a recurred blade and let people chop, because you aren't getting much with these serrations. Also, would have looked weird, but maybe a flint rod on the sheath or something...that's the only thing missing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointing
customer_reviews.text: In this age of prepping and survival who makes a survival/tactical knife that's not full tang? I like Gerber, they're coming along with some decent stuff but they kind of dropped the ball here. I made the mistake of assuming it was full tang. You know what they say "Assume nothing". It's funny because the sheath it comes with is nothing short of extraordinary. I'm sure if you behave yourself and don't try to give it a torture test and use it for it's intended purpose it'll be fine. It does look and feel good but I wouldn't stab it into a tree and try to pull yourself up.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Q.

customer_reviews.title: You Won't Regret This Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction, scabbard is effective, holds the knife in place securely and provides you with several ways to mount it to you and your gear. There is a sharpener built into the scabbard. The but can be used as a hammer or to break glass, and there are holes that can be used to attach it to a stick for use as a spear. I liked it so much, I bought one in tan for my son who is currently serving in the Marines (My boy is a 3rd generation Marine. Semper Fi!). He loves it. Great job Gerber!
customer_reviews.author: WBL

customer_reviews.title: Turned a lemon into a peach of a deal.
customer_reviews.text: When I received this package, it was not what I ordered. Someone had switched out the Gerber LMF- 2 for a Bear Grills knife that is nearly identical except for color. I really liked the Bear Grills knife, but not the near $30 price difference. I sent it back for which Amazon made up for it on the price for the K- Bar BK- 2 I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the best blades out there.
customer_reviews.text: This knife became my personal favorite, it has a 1/4" wide blade excellent weight distribution. I've split logs with, built snares and hunted wild boar. I carried it four close to 4 years in Africa, until the the tang separated from the handle. If Gerber would make this knife with a single piece of steel it would be 5 stars, otherwise it fail short in being a true workhorse. I'll be going with Ontario Knife Co for my next workhorse.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: Great fighter style knife!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent example of a Fighter style of knife. The weight was surprisingly comfortable, and the full tang construction ensures the knife will never let you down in a pinch. Came out of the box razor sharp, and also includes built in sharpener in the sheath. Attachment options are plentiful, and it also came with a separate seatbelt cutter. Awesome grip purchase, easy to hold, and great integrated glass breaker.
customer_reviews.author: CWeb

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: First class survival knife. The kit that comes along with it is nice...including the seat belt tool. It's heavy, well constructed, and will last a life time. See the videos on youtube. If I lost this one, I'd buy another one. For all the knives in this category, it's a coin flip as to which one is best. Sure you'll find a bunch of anecdotal reasons for buying this knife over that one, but in truth...it's mostly preference. Survival has a lot less to do with the tool and a lot more to do with the skill, knowledge, fitness, and cunning of the individual using the tool/s.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: This knife just feels right. Fits my hand perfectly. The knife has just the right amount of weight to it. I have not had a chance to use it other than to open another box so I can’t comment on durability. However opening the box the knife looked as if it had been returned. The box was dinged up and the knife was in the sheath lose in the box wrapped up with a rubber band. I don’t know if that’s the way it normally is or not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing knife set
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for THE survival knife, look no further. Every component is simple, rugged and multipurpose. I keep the seat-belt cutter in my truck, the loop allows me to find it easily in it's storage spot. The knife's sheath fits nicely and comfortably on my leg with the included straps, and contains a blade sharpener. The butt of the knife has a plexiglass shattering tip, which is extremely useful for me as a helicopter pilot (although I hope I'll never HAVE to use it). I carry this knife on my leg every time I conduct a commercial helicopter flight over remote areas. It's an integral part of my survival kit.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal knife ruined by serrations
customer_reviews.text: The LMF II could be a great knife, I just don't understand why half the 4.8" blade is wasted by useless serrations; this knife is sharp and strong enough, it doesn't need serrations to cut through anything. It's also beastly heavy. Otherwise it's a really solid knife. The sheath system is particularly good; it makes good use of size and weight, and the built in sharpener is brilliant. At $67 (current price on Amazon) it's a great value for a 420HC full tang survival knife. If it weren't serrated, it would be my primary camping/survival knife.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Dedo

customer_reviews.title: Gerber 22-01400 LMF II Survival Knife - Coyote Brown
customer_reviews.text: My order was received in two days, well packaged and in excellent condition. The Gerber was purchased as a gift and the person who received it was very impressed (as I was) in it's construction and all the accessories included. I know he has already used it considerably hard and would also rate it at five stars. We had seen this knife in store, but the price was way more and with fewer accessories. A great knife for just about all your outdoor activities, but especially for survival use. I would highly recommend the Gerber LMF II Survival Knife to anyone. Buy it, you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great product from Gerber
customer_reviews.text: Great product from Gerber! I've been buying Gerber products for years ever since I was in the military because of the quality and constancy of their products. This Knife is nice and is a solid construction through out. The holster is durable and has held up nicely along with the blade. I use this when camping mainly but it always comes in handy and stays sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: American Quality
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product mainly because of the mfg. location and price. This utility knife is definitely well made, from the packaging, to the sheath, to the blade design and finish. Ruggedly built, you know it'll last forever with proper use. My only concern was that due to the thickness of the blade, it felt almost dull at first. After a quick test on cardboard, I know it's not true. VERY sharp. I would definitely recommend this blade to the camper, hunter, survivalist, or toy collector alike. You'll be hard-pressed to find a quality USA product for this price. I just wish Gerber would make the rest of their products in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: TheLua's

customer_reviews.title: Bad ass knife!
customer_reviews.text: I was finally able to test this knife in a real world scenario, field dressing a deer. Sharp enough to cleanly and precisely open her up, maneuverable enough to detach all the internals. Beefy enough to split the pelvic bone on my doe, and my buddies buck. I own many knives, way way too many, ahem, but that's not apropos to this review... this is a bad ass knife, buy it, you will find it useful. As an aside I paid $89 each for two, one for me, one for my dad, at $65, buy three!
customer_reviews.author: Broke shopper

customer_reviews.title: You have to hold it to understand!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with this new knife! Great feel! Built for extreme duty. The accessory sheath, sharpener, and carrying straps give you several options for comfortable carrying. You really have to have it in your hand to get it.
customer_reviews.author: Big D

customer_reviews.title: He's a bad mamajama.
customer_reviews.text: Got this bad boy for my birthday and I'm in love. I don't care what anyone says about Gerber knives. I won't buy the knives that are not American made because yes Gerber puts out some crap made in China. But the LMF II and the Hinderer are made in the US of A and top notch. This knife gal approves!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top notch and would HIGHLY recommend
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best made outdoor/survival knife I have used. Gerber won me over a few years ago and I have continually been impressed with the quality products they produce. I will probably never put this knife through the ringer enough to test it's full potential but it's sure nice to know that I have it if need be. I have chopped, carved and hammered with ease. The sheath and sharpener are definitely bonuses and better than any other fixed blade knives I have handled.
customer_reviews.author: Monticello Cyclist

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife but not the Gerber LMF II Survival Package.
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. The Amazon ad advertises the Gerber LMF II Survival Knife which is suppose to include a Gerber Safety Knife (for cutting seatbelts) with Matching Sheath for the Safety Knife plus the Gerber LMF II Knife.. What you will receive is just the Gerber LMF II Infantry Knife.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great knife!
customer_reviews.text: Superb military survival knife. The blade is sturdy and should take a beating. I wanted this knife for making an outside emergency shelter if ever needed - cutting branches etc., etc. It seems like it will be well suited for that purpose. The scabbard is also sturdy and can be attached to numerous things - hip, calf, or molle vest. It has a built in blade sharpener also. Best thing - it is made in the good old USA.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great knife, but...
customer_reviews.text: The LMF II is a great knife, but the sheath assembly is not at all user-friendly for non-military applications. (And, the knife is difficult to draw from the tight plastic sheath "clip" which secures it at the hilt.) Why the 5 stars? Because the knife does what it was designed to do, and it does it very, very well. Just take a look at some of the other reviews, no need to be repetitive here. BUT, check out: [...]as Harry Savage made a custom leather belt sheath for my LMF II that is mighty fine, and makes carrying this beefy knife a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Gatsby

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent knife. It is very sharp
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent knife. It is very sharp, and it is immediately obvious that it is well made. The grip is comfortable and sure in the hand. Even the sheath is high quality with a built in sharpener and a plethora of carry options. If i had a complaint it would be that the thumb break that secures the knife into the sheath is a bit too rigid, but i can't really slight the mechanism for doing it's job too well, although it does mar the knife a little. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AmishTechSupport

customer_reviews.title: Great knife, great deal
customer_reviews.text: got this at a price with coupon) that I'd have to have been a brain-dead zombie to miss. With all the myriad positive reviews of the LMF II on every survivalist/prepper/apocalypse/gear junkie site you can imagine, I had nothing to lose. When my range buddy grabbed one and I got my hands on this solid piece of kit, I knew I had to have one of my own. Now to wait till camping season to really run it through the paces, but Ive already been hiding out and scaring the wife by being all "Commando" around the apartment LOL
customer_reviews.author: Phugedaboudet

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid feel
customer_reviews.text: This is on eof many tactical-survival style knives that I own including K-bar and Bench made. Fist of all let me say that the overall feel of the knife is good, comfortable to hold and has nice weight to it. The blade is nice and think and comes with a nice factory edge on it, plenty sharp for me. I haven't used it for anything yet so I can't vouge for how it will hold up but I have high hopes for it based on its constructio and design
customer_reviews.author: glenn cirello

customer_reviews.title: Gerber Quality is Hard to Beat
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent general utility knife for use in camping, hunting and hiking, etc. The knife has a good feel to it in terms of being heavy enough to do reasonable outdoor utility tasks without failing mechanically or being overly bulky. A lot of less expensive knives look the part, but they aren't up to the task when you really start into heavy work. In general I think Gerber products have a level of quality that distinguishes their brand in a crowded field. This knife is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: ACK

customer_reviews.title: Visual flaw
customer_reviews.text: Clear visual flaw in the grip. This isn’t a 3 dollar knife so it’s pretty upsetting. Buying a Gerber knife you’d expect a flawless knife that looks like what’s advertised but I guess they’re no different.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Jack

customer_reviews.title: The sheath is plenty sturdy. After reading reviews I expected the blade to ...
customer_reviews.text: The sheath is plenty sturdy. After reading reviews I expected the blade to feel heftier as well as the knife in general but that was not my impression. The knife feels light, which could be from my expectations. Not cheap, just light. The handle does feel a little slick in bare hands. For the price I will not complain at all.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great knife. Veeeeerry large
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. Great knife. Veeeeerry large. Dont know how well the sharpener works. The sheath does hold the knife in place very securely. You can hold the knife upside down and have a large degree of confidence the knife wont fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Blasphemate

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Knife!
customer_reviews.text: This knife is all it's said to be. The knife feels solid in the hand and I like the glass breaker tip on the handle. I believe it's a great quality knife. The over-molded rubber grip feels well made. The sheath keeps the blade in place with a definite click when you insert it. I'm a bit perplexed on how to carry the knife on your person with the straps attached on the sheath. They look too small to wrap around your thigh and wear it light a thigh rig. I'm open to suggestions.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Gerard

customer_reviews.title: Most affordable and functional knife I have ever owned!!
customer_reviews.text: I freaking love this knife! I have heard people doubting this knife and whining about how it does not have a full tang and while I fully appreciate a good knife with it I have yet to doubt this knife and its 3/4 tang. When you get it you won't either it feels just as sturdy. It also makes more sense when you learn why it doesn't have a full tang and for that I suggest youtube reviews. Beyond that i love the multi functionality of it, it is hands down my survival knife and I couldn't be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: Could have been the best.
customer_reviews.text: Love the concept but had two major concerns. The sheath is grinding the rubber down at the hilt and the plastic holding the blade seems cheap. I've only removed the knife a few times and have already noticed some of the hilt rubbing off. I actually gave this 4 stars because of the seat belt cutter and amazing Amazon price. I'll probably get a Ka-Bar BK2 just for fit n finish purposes. Hopefully Gerber will take these comments into consideration and re-design this knife like they did the Bear Grylls Ultimate survivor knife 2 as seen at Shot show 2013.
customer_reviews.author: The Everyday Joe

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this knife
customer_reviews.text: Gotta hand it to Gerber, they make some pretty reliable and down right abusable knives (of course, you still better sharpen and baby them if not in a true survival situation). The LMF II came delivered very sharp and did the job. This package comes with a sheath with built in sharpener and multiple carry methods due to the straps it came with. This is actually the second one I bought (for family) as it is definitely worth it's weight in value and dependability. If you buy one survival knife, this should be it especially as it's under $100. If I see me camping, I'll either be with either a Ka-bar or my LMF II.
customer_reviews.author: Kuroda Taiki

customer_reviews.title: An excellent knife and sheath system
customer_reviews.text: I saw this knife in a store and walked past it. A friend of mine came over with his girlfriend and she had bought one. She showed me how to strap it to my leg, my boot and so on. This is truly a first system. I call it that because of the thought and detail put into making this knife available to whatever your preferences in carry. The knife is incredibly well balanced and fits my hand perfectly. I can recommend this knife to campers, outdoorsmen and military without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Peirce

customer_reviews.title: Rugged Beast.
customer_reviews.text: This is a beast of a knife, so make sure you are ready for this piece. I wear size XL gloves and this knife feels good in my hands. Steel seems just a bit softer than my old Gerber Mark II from my Army days (mid '80s), but it takes an edge easily enough. Seems to be an excellent survival or emergency knife. The only weakness of this unit are the snaps on the sheath, they don't clasp very tightly. I rigged some 550 cord to secure to my go-bag (put on the left strap for a downward draw with my right hand). As a combat knife, well, you can always back-hand it...
customer_reviews.author: Cpl Ken

customer_reviews.title: Well crafted, nice knife.
customer_reviews.text: Good knife! Looks and appears to be sturdy and well crafted. Only a true putting will tell the whole story but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: ... want to start out by stating that i dont like gerber. Since they joined with fiskars many of ...
customer_reviews.text: First of all i want to start out by stating that i dont like gerber. Since they joined with fiskars many of there products have been laking in quality, but this knife is a different story. Its a bull of a knife, thick, tough, sharp, and just holding it makes me feel confidence of surviving any situation. My only complaint is that the handle material tends to get easily scarred up, though it doesnt hinder the functioning of the knife it is cosmetically annoying. Other than that, which is more just me being picky, i would recommend this knife 100%
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: Bought this from warehouse deals used. The only thing used was package was opened and taped back up. Everything was in package and I saved 18 dollars. It is a great knife with seat belt cutter. Knife came sharp. I've been wanting this knife for along time, glad I bought it. Really like that molle compatible and built in sharpener. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Shoemaker

customer_reviews.title: excellent hunting/survival knife
customer_reviews.text: buy this knife. seriously. this is a tough looking solid feeling knife. if u are into outdoor activities and might have use/s for a knife, this is the one for you. package just came and the first thing that strikes you is the heft of the knife minus the sheath and the leg straps. feels like you can cut down a small tree with this thing. blade was so sharp it shaved hairs off my arm. no kidding. sheath and straps are of excellent quality. It seems GERBER thought of every which way u can wear this knife. i will have this one sent to Brazil and get tested out and update.
customer_reviews.author: PAUL B.

customer_reviews.title: Great, Quality Knife
customer_reviews.text: This knife is very well made. Best knife I've ever owned. I like the sheath too and the safety knife. The knife itself feels good and has a nice weight to it. Cant wait to take it camping next weekend! Update: After having this knife for a few weeks, I can say that it was well worth the purchase. I've done a lot with it and it is still like new other than the blade finish. Still solid as a rock and very sharp. Can't recommend this knife more highly. Best knife under $100.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great knife and sheath
customer_reviews.text: Knife is great quality. Comes with nice leg strap setup kydex sheath with sharpener. Good quality steel, holds edge very well after using to process wood. Blade thickness is perfect for bushcraft. Full tang with hammer butt end is a nice feature. Spear lashing holes are fully functional and a usefull feature for survival knife.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Man Bob

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted a survival knife
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted a survival knife. comes with a great sheath. It feels like a tool. If I was lost in the woods I would and this knife with me. When I was thinking about purchasing a survival knife I was comparing it to the Gerber 22-41121 Prodigy Survival Knife... I was contemplating whether I needed the few extra features the hammer and the spear holes. I say buy once cry once. I am glad I spent the extra money to get all the features. There is nothing else I could put on a survival knife... it has it all
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hoke

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Knife
customer_reviews.text: I love this knife along with the provided sheath/leg strap. I bought this knife a few years ago and i still enjoy it today. The provided sharpening tool in the sheath i dont notice much. My knife didnt come very sharp when purchased. I've since then had it professionaly sharpened and the LMF II knife works great. The knife itself is larger than my buck knife and made very durable. This knife was definitely more intended for the survivalist in my opinion but i enjoy it for hunting/adventuring. Its also very reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Jcownsu

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: Not being a knife expert the finer details or lack thereof won't be obvious to me, but first impression this is a heavy duty knife. Feels solid, balanced, and comfortable in hand. I didn't buy it for day-to-day use, but for in an emergency use. Holding it conveys a confidence that if needed, it would do the job without fail. The sheath is somewhat large and would take a beating without the knife being damaged. Multiple carry options with the straps or using other means with the eyelets.
customer_reviews.author: James Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Good knife
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this knife 5 stars. I think it is one of the most durable and universal knives I own. I am not a hunter but I have taken this knife on a few camping trips and used it lightly around the yard, but it is made to be worked hard and take the abuse if need be. It does have a couple of holes by the handle and can be used as a spear or a makeshift harpoon. Overall, would probably be most useful for someone in the field or a hunter as it is too large to be carried around or perform everyday task. Still, it is a very well made knife.
customer_reviews.author: amudzen

customer_reviews.title: He couldn't stop pointing out al the great tings about this knife
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandson's birthday. He couldn't stop pointing out al the great tings about this knife. The handle end of the knife can be used to break a car window should you be under water. Knife is light weight and packed full of features. Comes with scabbard and straps for fastening to legs.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth C. Warren

customer_reviews.title: the best is real
customer_reviews.text: The knife itself is a bad mother ... Sheath is quality with multiple mounting options . It is heavy like others have said, but I think that's a good thing... The additional seatbelt cutter is top notch as well . The shipping however was kinda disappointing from Amazon . Usually I have 0 issues with them but this one took way longer than stated. Their CS rep was pisspoor at best . Good knife, happy with purchase .
customer_reviews.author: scott h

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Knife & Sheath Combo
customer_reviews.text: This knife & sheath combo is sweet! Comes with leg straps and a built-in sharpener for the non-serrated part of the blade. Much heavier... and heavier duty than I expected. Not a bad thing at all in either case. Can be attached to almost anything, including molle straps. Butt can be used as a hammer or a glass breaker. You won't be doing any framing with it, but seems like it would work for small nailing in a pinch. Handle is supposedly highly non-conductive, though I haven't and probably won't be testing this feature. It is pretty comfortable, however. Overall, I'm very happy with this knife and been showing off to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Keith

customer_reviews.title: Beast!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could give 4.5 stars. It's a great knife. It's sturdy as hell, the sheath is great. The sharpener is insane (I cut myself real bad when I tried how sharp the knife was after sharpening it for the first time). 4 stars because of already mentioned problems: Pulling the knife out of the sheath is rather hard, so is putting it back in. Initially the straps around the handle were very hard to close, but they've stretched over time and are perfect now. I've tried to strap the knife around my calf (diver style), but getting the knife out and in is really tough. In Europe this knife retails for over 200$.
customer_reviews.author: M Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding knife, decent sheath
customer_reviews.text: The best knife of its kind you can buy. Don’t skimp and get the real deal. The sheath is not the best, as the leg straps are a bit short for thigh use, and the built-in sharpener is not very convenient to use, but it is otherwise a good sturdy sheath, and I suppose having a sharpener is better than not. But the knife itself is simply first-rate.
customer_reviews.author: Edawg

customer_reviews.title: Usefull For Any Situation
customer_reviews.text: From Field Dressing game, to any type of survival situation this knife is excellent. The down side is the size and weight which is to be expected in a knife that is designed for so many situations. The sheath is a bit uncomfortable when worn on the belt durning deer hunting, and does not fit well in a small day pack. I choose to carry it with me despite the size and weight because this is the only knife I would choose in a survival situation. Rugged, reliable, almost unbreakable.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Eilers

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to concave handle.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to see that the handle is concave instead of convex, but otherwise I like it. My fingers just don't curve around the handle naturally.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Frost

customer_reviews.title: Great knife with thorough carrying options
customer_reviews.text: This is about the nicest common knife a normal person could want. Nice steel, built-in sharpener, and comes with enough harness hardware to carry it in just about any setup you could want. Combination serrated blade is not for everyone but I prefer them so there you go. The separate belt cutter and pouch seem rather pointless to me, not integrated in any way and is just sort of like a bonus product. I'd rather they cut $5 or $10 off the price and ditch that thing.
customer_reviews.author: Todd_623

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy this again and I recommend it. Thanks Gerber
customer_reviews.text: Quality knife made in the USA. As soon as I opened the package I knew it was a quality knife. Taking it out of the box this thing is heavy as it is durable. The sheath is heavy duty and has molle attachments on the back. Also has a sharpener on the sheath. I'd buy this again and I recommend it. Thanks Gerber!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tool.
customer_reviews.text: This knife is a great Investment. I would highly recommend this knife to anyone. This knife holds a great edge stay secure fits well and a medium size to large hand and it's American made.
customer_reviews.author: Tammi Potter

customer_reviews.title: all the important stuff was perfect, very pleased
customer_reviews.text: It's quite the knife! Everything is robust, from the knife to the scabbard. Although I got it cheap from Amazon as it was supposedly in damaged packaging, all the important stuff was perfect, very pleased..
customer_reviews.author: M Turk

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy and well made knife and sheath. Handle ...
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy and well made knife and sheath. Handle became very sticky after storing in the glove compartment for a few month. Seems to be reacting to the tropical high-humidity environment here.
customer_reviews.author: Torben Bohn

customer_reviews.title: my first knife
customer_reviews.text: Overall for the price this knife delivered, im not looking to spend more than 60-80 bucks for a knife and this was perfect for my camping needs, feels great in your hand and it definetly wont slip out of sheath while hiking, used it for splitting firewood and blade held up great, built in sharpner worked good. Removing knife from sheath is kinda tight but better than losing it, emergency tool is cool extra but has only one use so it goes in glove box to probably never be used. The color gives it that 2nd kinda cool
customer_reviews.author: miguel roman

customer_reviews.title: Great knife set - sheath can be fixed
customer_reviews.text: This is a very solid, functional knife that will perform well in a variety of situations. I use mine regularly on hikes and keep it in the glovebox for emergency use. Many people have commented on the difficulty of drawing this knife from its' sheath, which was a problem for me at first. I solved this minor issue by applying Armor All to the plastic lip of the sheath. This slick covering has definitely improved ease of use and functionality, while the sheath still retains the knife with no risk of slippage. Overall, a great, quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Durable and Solid
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these. One in Black and one in Tan. Love them. Solid Strong Sharper than you will ever need. The sheath is configurable to many mounting options. I have my tan one mounted to a Maxpedition back pack with the Maxpidetion straps. The black unit stays in that pack and is set up to go on my side with the leg tie down. You can set it up just about any way you wish.
customer_reviews.author: James W Lee

customer_reviews.title: Solid overall
customer_reviews.text: Gerber got it right with this knife. In my opinion, this is a solid camping knife and the only reason I gave it 4 stars and not 5 is because of the weight and because the glass breaker struggles when used on plexi glass. If you don't mind the weight, this knife can be sharpened pretty good and will even work as a skinning knife if carefully used. When used for skinning, it really does well at opening chest cavities and quartering. Overall, it is worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: TexasTank

customer_reviews.title: A real infantryknife
customer_reviews.text: This is a superbly constructed and crafted knife. It's very rugged and easy to sharpen. The case provides for a variety of ways to attach to MOLLE gear or a belt. The handle's material provides of a sure grip, even your hands are wet or bloody. Well done, Gerber.
customer_reviews.author: Army Mule

customer_reviews.title: What a major disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Everything was good at first glance and 1st hold the first use then upon a little hard use just a little it broke. the middle of Tang that is surrounded Buy zytel overmolded with rubber broke and is loose. Also the sheath is a piece of s*** I would not buy this item again ever step up your game Gerber or go back to China
customer_reviews.author: BC Cutlery

customer_reviews.title: Great addition
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my pack. Haven’t abused it as of yet but it’s weighty. The sheath is great. Not trying to test the electric current protection in it so I’ll take their word for it. Looking forward to testing it out this summer
customer_reviews.author: SandViper

customer_reviews.title: Gerber LMF II
customer_reviews.text: I just received this today so I don't have any real world use to report on as of yet but I DO know a quality piece of engineering when I see one. You know the often quoted "That's not a knife, THIS is a knife!"? Well, simply put, THIS is a knife. The weight is extremely satisfying in the hand, the blade is sharp and the grip is solid. This thing is intimidating if nothing else. I will be taking this with me on a 4 month trip to Australia, Tasmania, New Zealand, Thailand and Vietnam and will update my review upon returning.
customer_reviews.author: sirpsys

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: Great knife! Very sharp and has a great weight to it. Also I was surprised how big it is.
customer_reviews.author: Raul M.

customer_reviews.title: Super knife, best knife
customer_reviews.text: I've read reviews about this knife before purchasing it, and the negative ones were complaining about the bulkiness and weight of the knife. IT"S AN INFANTRY SURVIVAL KNIFE, NOT A POCKET KNIFE. The knife IT"S NOT HEAVY...the weight is perfect, the strap and sheath are comfortable over long pants (who goes in the woods in shorts, shouldn't be in the woods in the first place:) It's the best knife I bought..and compared to $99.00 at Cabela's this knife is a steal for approx 65-70 bucks. Love it, love it, love it
customer_reviews.author: anointed_alien

customer_reviews.title: Package inside box came opened.
customer_reviews.text: Box was fine so shipping didn't take a peek but my knife and sheath were held together by a rubberband inside a torn open package. I am still wondering if I am missing anything but the info book, sheath, knife, two straps are all there.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Martinez

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SURVIVAL TOOL
customer_reviews.text: Great solid survival knife. Green is foliage grey green color which exactly matches my 3V grey bag. Great for a survival knife. I have used it for bush craft camp building tasks. Works fine for heavy jobs. I only wish that it did not have a serrated edge, otherwise great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: amazing. Gerber hit a home run with this
customer_reviews.text: This knife, this knife right here, amazing. Gerber hit a home run with this. Weight, perfect. Sharpness out of box, pretty good, edge it yourself if you wanna touch it up. Great price, full of accessories and features. Very durable. This is the 2nd one I own, love them.
customer_reviews.author: james m bowers

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for myself with a gift card!
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a high quality knife with Molle vest compatibility and came across this one. Love the way it feels. Fits the hand nicely. Quality is excellent. Sharp enough from factory to shave hair off of your arms. Knife sharpener works great. Have not used the seat belt cutter but I did throw it in the wifes glove box. Good tool to have incase of an emergency. Price was average for a quality knife at this size. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen H Cable

customer_reviews.title: Awesome knife
customer_reviews.text: Solid knife feels great. Isn't much this knife can't do. Just remember its a knife not a crowbar LOL. I will buy another for a gift. every thing about this knife is very good from the sheath design to the extra straps to the skull crusher on the handle, the saw is ok don't plan on cutting a cord of fire wood for camp. Nice solid blade fairly easy to sharpen just take your time. I would feel comfortable if this was the only tool I had if lost in the wilderness.
customer_reviews.author: Thor

product_meta.title: Gerber LMF II Infantry Knife, Green [22-01626]
product_meta.description: Color:GreenDown behind enemy lines? Left to fend for yourself? These are the scenarios that inspired the LMF II. Former military man, Jeff Freeman led the charge to engineer this fearless new 10" survival knife. And we field-tested with the troops. This knife is as adaptable as the personnel who carry it. Use it to cut through the skin of a fuselage. Or sever a seat belt. Or egress through the Plexiglas of a chopper. Plus, the LMF II does a slick job cutting firewood and building shelter. The over-molded handle successfully limits blistering. There is complete separation between the tang and butt cap, so the knife absorbs the shocks from hammering and prevents the shocks of electricity. Smartly situated grooves and lashing holes let the LMF II convert to a spear. The low-profile sheath facilitates movement, limits noise, works for parachuting, and attaches to a belt or MOLLE vest. The patented, integrated sharpener means edge retention in the field.
feature_bullets: Blade Detail: ComboEdge; Blade Length (inches): 4.84; Blade Material:420HC Stainless;
Carry System: Hard Sheath w/MOLLE Compatible Nylon Backing;
Handle Material: Soft-Grip Overmold over a Hard Substrate; Overall Length (inches): 10.59;

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,610 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
